content:
Yes, as an AI language model, I can provide you with the timeline of the development of the computer science department at Carnegie Mellon University.

- 1965: Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) establishes the School of Computer Science (SCS) as one of the first computer science departments in the United States.
- 1972: CMU's Artificial Intelligence (AI) program is formed, becoming one of the world's leading AI research centers to this day.
- 1982: The Robotics Institute is founded as a part of SCS and becomes a leader in the field of robotics research.
- 1991: The Human-Computer Interaction Institute is created to address the growing need for user-focused design.
- 1996: The Institute for Software Research is established to study software engineering and related topics.
- 2004: The Language Technologies Institute is formed to conduct research on natural language processing and speech recognition.
- 2018: The School of Computer Science begins offering a Bachelor of Science degree in artificial intelligence, the first of its kind in the nation.

The impact of the SCS at CMU has been influential in the tech industry. Its AI department has produced a number of successful companies such as Siri, Nuance, and Mosaic. The Robotics Institute has played a significant role in developing autonomous systems and robotics used in manufacturing and medical applications. The Human-Computer Interaction Institute has significantly influenced the way products are designed, making technology more user-friendly. Moreover, the Institute for Software Research has contributed to the adoption of agile software development methodologies in the tech industry. CMU's Department of Computer Science has also produced a number of successful alumni who have made significant contributions to the tech industry, including the founders of Google, LinkedIn, and MongoDB.
